posts.title: Build Personal Blog With Hexo and GitHub
posts.text: This article is a step by step instruction on creating a personal website using Hexo framework on GitHub pages with custom domain. What is Hexo?Hexo is a simple yet powerful static blog framework powered by Node.js. Setup and InstallationGitHub Create a GitHub account Create a new repository named <github_username>.github.io Git Install Git Configure your Git username/email Open the Git Bash Set your username:git config --global user.name <github_username> Set your email address:git config --global user.email <github_email> Generate SSH Key and add to GitHub From Git Bash, generate SSH key ssh-keygen -t rsa -C <github_email> Copy the SSH key from the id_rsa.pub file, and paste to GitHub SSH key setting page From Git Bash, check if the setting is successful. ssh git@github.com Node.js Install Node.js From Git Bash, check if Node.js install successfully. node -v Check if npm install successfully. npm -v HexoInstall Hexo with npm npm install -g hexo-cli Start Blogging Initialize the blog in current directory hexo init Create a new article hexo new <title> Edit the markdown file under /source/_posts Generate static file hexo generate Start local server hexo server Check the blog at http://localhost:4000 Change Theme Choose theme Clone the theme to /themes foldergit clone <github_repo> Edit the _config.yml file in root directory to use the new theme# Extensions ## Plugins: https://hexo.io/plugins/ ## Themes: https://hexo.io/themes/ theme: <theme_name> Follow the instructions of the new theme for further setting. Start local serverhexo server Check the blog at http://localhost:4000 Deploy GitHub Pages Edit the _config.yml file in root directorydeploy: type: git repo: <repository_url> branch: master Install hexo deployer pluginnpm install hexo-deployer-git --save Deploy the sitehexo clean && hexo generate && hexo deploy Check the blog at http://<github_username>.github.io Front-matter and Other Setting Enable table of contentstoc: true Apply categories and tagscategories: - <categoriy_name> tags: - <tag_name> Enable read more<!-- more --> Use Custom Domain Backup and Recover Raw Files on GitHub Backup Files Setup new branch for the raw files and push to GitHub Delete the .gitignore file and the .git folder in the theme folder. Push the raw files to the branch called hexo. git init . git checkout -b hexo # new branch git add . git commit -m '<commit messae>' git remote add origin <repository_url> git push --set-upstream origin hexo Continue push new update to GitHub git add -a git commit -m "<commit messae>" git push origin hexo Recover Files git clone <repository_url> cd <github_username>.github.io/ git checkout hexo npm install hexo server
